dlgPart.npc_text: You notice a boy, hardly older than fifteen, looking at you with poorly concealed curiosity.

dlgAnsw.text: Approach.
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: END
“You killed them all,” says the youth. “You must be a great warrior.”

dlgAnsw.text: “The best there is.”
“I was lucky. But I’ve always been lucky when it comes to killing folks.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Really?” asks the youth, his eyes growing big. “You must be a great warrior.”

dlgAnsw.text: “The best there is.”
“I was lucky. But I’ve always been lucky when it comes to killing folks.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “What do they want from us? We don’t have anything of value.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Many people will pay a good price for your potions and elixirs.”
“They don’t know it. They see a well guarded place and think that you’re protecting something valuable.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “What did you tell them?” asks the youth. “Why did they leave us alone?”

dlgAnsw.text: “I told them I would kill them all if they stay.”
“I managed to scare them off, but they’ll be back one day. You should be ready for it.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Our elders say that the world is an evil place and we’re better off here, up in the mountains.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Your elders are right. The world is harsh and cruel. You go there and you’ll either end up dead or become harsh and cruel yourself in order to survive.”
“You only get one life. Are you sure you want to spend it hiding up in the mountains?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “But the elders say –”

dlgAnsw.text: “The elders tell you the same tale their elders told them. They don’t know what life is like out there.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “You think I should leave?”

dlgAnsw.text: “Definitely. Go out there, have some fun. Live a little.”

“It’s your decision, not mine. Think it through; consider how it would affect this community. If you leave, others might leave too. Without enough people to maintain and defend this place, it will soon cease to exist.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “They hardly even notice me.”

dlgAnsw.text: “They will notice you when you’re gone, trust me.”
“Then what are you wasting my time for?”

dlgPart.npc_text: The youth shrugs and looks away.

dlgAnsw.text: “What else the elders tell you?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Is there no hope then?” asks the youth trying to sound more mature than he is.

dlgAnsw.text: “None.”
“There is always hope.”
“Hope didn’t protect you from those who came to pillage and murder, did it?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “All kinds of tales. I used to believe them when I was a kid, but now I’m not so sure. Even if the tales are true, the gods are long gone, so what difference does it make?”

dlgAnsw.text: “The gods?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “The elders say that when the gods’ mortal bodies sustained grievous injuries in battles, they were brought here to be healed and restored. They say that those special chambers were built deep in the mountain where the gods would be safe while they recovered.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Have you ever seen these chambers?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “If they exist, they’re behind the Titan’s Gate, but it has never been opened, so you can say just about anything. You can say that one of the gods is still there, locked for eternity, and who's going to say you're wrong?”

dlgAnsw.text: “The Titan’s Gate?”
“Why would a god be locked for eternity?”
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: “It’s a large metal door at the end of the main hall. The elders say that the ancestors locked it from the inside and left through doorways glowing in their wake, whatever that means. After seeing the devastation, they returned here. They forbade us to venture out and gave us our laws and the sacred formulae.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Sacred formulae?”
“What else do you know about your ancestors?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “They gave us the formulae so that we could heal our sick, purify water, and grow crops. They told us that the formulae are sacred and that the gods will punish us if we deviate from the instructions. Crops will die, water will turn foul, men will become sick and women will give birth to abominations,” says the boy, copying the elders and making a sign to ward off evil spirits.

dlgAnsw.text: “What else do you know about your ancestors?”
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: “The elders say that they were men of great learnings and that even the gods sought their wisdom, so we must honor them and stay on the path they laid out for us, until the gods awaken and return.”

dlgAnsw.text: “And how would you know when it happens if you’re stuck on the mountain in the middle of nowhere?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “That’s easy,” smiles the youth. “When the gods return, the Titan’s Gate will open and the gods will recognize us as the children of those who served them faithfully and see that we have the knowledge to serve them once more.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You mentioned sacred formulae?”
Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: “Don’t the stories say that some gods turned away from us, favoring the demons from across the sea? Isn’t that how the Great War started?”

dlgAnsw.text: “You mentioned the Titan’s Gate?”

dlgPart.npc_text: END - bark Elder said no talk
